pullRequest.title: [BEAM-10124] Compute number of records before each offset using a Multimap sideinput keyed with a filename.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Compute number of records before each offset using a Multimap sideinput keyed with a filename to alleviate memory consumption concerns to materialize side input, see: #12924 (comment).
I am somewhat conflicted about this change since this adds a O(num_read_ranges_in_file) lookup per each row. I thought about using  Map <file_name, Map <offset, num_records_before_each_offset>> for contextual metadata in the side input, but according to offline discussion with @lukecwik, who is currently OOO, materialization will not work in this case.
Happy to follow up if there is a better suggestion to address the existing memory concerns.

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.
